skill.name: nodejs-backend-patterns
skill.description: Build production-ready Node.js backend services with Express/Fastify, implementing middleware patterns, error handling, authentication, database integration, and API design best practices. Use when creating Node.js servers, REST APIs, GraphQL backends, or microservices architectures.
skill.summary: Build production-ready Node.js backend services with Express/Fastify, implementing middleware patter...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This skill is a static markdown guide with code examples and no executable scripts. Examples show typical backend networking and environment variable usage. No malicious or obfuscated behavior is present.

content.user_title: Build Node.js backend services with proven patterns
content.value_statement: Backend projects often lack structure and consistent middleware patterns. This skill provides clear Node.js examples for architecture, authentication, validation, and error handling.
actual_capabilities: Shows Express and Fastify server setup with security middleware
Defines layered architecture with controllers, services, and repositories
Provides JWT authentication and authorization middleware examples
Includes validation middleware patterns with Zod
Covers PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Redis integration patterns
limitations: Does not generate a runnable project or install dependencies
Does not provide deployment, hosting, or CI configuration
Testing guidance is referenced but not included in this skill
Examples are illustrative and need adaptation to your app

use_cases.title: Plan a REST API structure
use_cases.description: Apply controllers, services, repositories, and middleware patterns for a new Node.js API.

use_cases.title: Standardize service architecture
use_cases.description: Create consistent patterns for error handling, logging, and dependency injection across teams.

use_cases.title: Add secure authentication
use_cases.description: Implement JWT login, refresh tokens, and role checks with clear middleware guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Create Express starter
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner setup for a small API
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a minimal Express server with Helmet, CORS, JSON parsing, and a health route. Use TypeScript.

prompt_templates.title: Add input validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide Zod schema and Express middleware for a create user route. Explain how to attach the middleware.

prompt_templates.title: Design service layers
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline controller, service, and repository files for a user resource with dependency injection and clear responsibilities.

prompt_templates.title: Implement JWT auth
prompt_templates.prompt: Show JWT authentication and role authorization middleware and describe how to secure an admin route.

output_examples.input: Outline a Node.js backend structure with middleware and auth
output: Define controllers, services, repositories, and middleware folders
Add JWT authentication and role based authorization
Include validation middleware for request bodies
Add centralized error handling and request logging

best_practices: Use TypeScript and validate inputs at the edge
Centralize error handling and structured logging
Keep controllers thin and move logic to services
anti_patterns: Put database queries directly in route handlers
Return stack traces to clients in production
Skip rate limiting on authentication endpoints

faq.question: Is this compatible with Express and Fastify?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes guidance and examples for both frameworks.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples, not a full project scaffold or deployment setup.

faq.question: Can I use it in an existing service?
faq.answer: Yes. You can adopt specific patterns like middleware, DI, or error handling.

faq.question: Does the skill access or transmit data?
faq.answer: No. The skill is static guidance and does not execute or transmit data.

faq.question: What should I check if patterns do not work?
faq.answer: Verify environment variables, middleware order, and error handler placement.

faq.question: How is this different from general Node.js guides?
faq.answer: It focuses on concrete backend patterns for structure, security, and maintainability.
